title: Contemporary Washington-area homes on display at architecture tour
text:
Six homes in the District, Maryland and Northern Virginia will be open to the public on Oct. 5 during the tour organized by the Modern Architecture + Design Society (MA+DS) and the Contemporary Listings Group at TTR Sotheby’s International Realty. (KVR Studio)

While architecture experts and students frequently tour contemporary homes to see the latest design elements, the D.C.-Metro Modern Home Tour opens properties to anyone who wants a chance to learn about modern architecture or get some inspiration for future projects.

Six homes in the District, Maryland and Northern Virginia will be open to the public on Oct. 5 during the 2019 D.C.-Metro Modern Home Tour organized by the Modern Architecture + Design Society (MA+DS) and the Contemporary Listings Group at TTR Sotheby’s International Realty.

[A modern mountain retreat offers views in every direction]

Visitors can see:

· A modern addition to a mid-century modern home in North Kensington, Md.

· A tiny mid-century modern home renovated into a small modern home by McInturff Architects in Takoma Park, Md.

· A modern renovation of a 1957 Garrett Park, Md., home into a multigenerational residence by Tom Wheeler.

· A modern three-story home in Great Falls, Va., designed by Whipple Russell Architects.

· A new renovation and addition to a 1950s-era brick rambler in Arlington, Va., by Paola One Design.

· A new modern custom home in Fairfax, Va., by architect Hyun Kim and KCI Design Build.

And a nonresidential project: a shipping container in Tenleytown repurposed by Travis Price Architects that currently serves as an art gallery.

During the self-guided tour, which takes place from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m., participants can visit each home and ask questions of architects, designers and builders who will be present at the properties.

The tour, which costs $40 in advance and $50 on the tour day, benefits the American Institute of Architecture Students chapter at the University of Maryland, College Park.

For more information on the tour and to purchase tickets, visit www.dcmetromodernhometour.com.
